ygData.subject: Re: Optional locations
ygData.msgSnippet: After you give Tergon the book, he gives you a quest to kill a pirate gnome magician in OOT. I killed the pirate gnome and he dropped a Tier Dal Head. I took
ygData.messageBody:
After you give Tergon the book, he gives you a quest to kill a pirate gnome
magician in OOT. I killed the pirate gnome and he dropped a Tier'Dal Head. I
took the head to Tergon and he gave me the Elemental Grimoire (Magician
research book). The quest ends there and has nothing to do with tinkering.

Brillian Novaspire
26th level Gnome Wizard
Solusek Ro




> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Zach Heaven <zheaven@...>
> To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, October 05, 1999 11:45 AM
> Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Optional locations
> > First I want someone to tell me what the gnome in the back of crushbone
in
> the
> > pit is for? I was there when I was in my teens, but have not returned
to
> see
> > what he did.
>
> The gnome in crushbone is actually part of the Tergon's Spellbook quest
> which has recently been fixed since Bugglepup the gnome now spawns in
> steamfont. When you talk to Tergon in ak'anon he says to retrieve a metal
> pellet that he shot Bugglepup with and lost. Well once you return it to
him
> he tells you to search out his brother in Freeport and give him a letter
> that tells him to give you the spellbook. So you goto freeport and learn
> that he was captured by the orcs. So you take the letter to him in
> crushbone and he tells you the oracle in the castle took the book. Kill
the
> oracle, return the book and tergon sends you to oot to kill a renegade
gnome
> thats taken up with the pirates of gunthark. Thats as far as I've gotten
> with the quest.
>
> I was really hopeing it would yield tinkering info because Tergon says he
> shot bugglepup with one of his contraptions. (a tinker made shotgun of
some
> sort??) :) Anyone ever finish all of Tergon's quests to the end?
>
> ---
> gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
> "Linux... find out what you've been missing while
> you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld
>
>
